ai.summary: A 7 km circular walk around Habberley Valley in Worcestershire, England. The route threads woodland trails, lakeside paths and glimpses of quarry geology, delivering a scenic moderate hike suitable for most walkers. Expect a mix of gentle climbs, uneven surfaces and shaded sections.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain combines firm forest tracks, gravel paths, grassy edges and sections with roots or small steps. Some routes run along boardwalks by the lakes; surfaces can be muddy after rain, and parts may be uneven or rocky.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and check weather forecasts; stay on marked paths; watch for uneven ground, slippery mud and loose rocks after rain. Bring a map or offline navigation, adequate water and snacks, a lightweight rain jacket, and a small first-aid kit. Keep dogs under control and be mindful of other walkers. Parking is in designated areas; exercise caution when approaching road junctions.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing (layered, with a waterproof jacket)
Map or offline navigation (phone with offline maps)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) is generally best for daylight, wildlife viewing and trail conditions; the walk can be done year-round with appropriate footwear and weather gear.

seo.title: Habberley Valley Circular Walk – 7 km Moderate Hike in Worcestershire, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Habberley Valley Circular Walk: a 7 km moderate hike through woods, lakes and quarry geology in Worcestershire, England. Practical tips, best seasons and gear.
